item.title: Caravan, 3rd January
item.description:
In the layby just before the turning to Hartley farm and leckhampton quarry road, on leckhampton road, there is a caravan abandoned. The rest window is smashed. It has been there since before Christmas.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This car has been parked and therefore blocking the use of an EV bay since mid December. It had 3 parking tickets on 19th Dec but even the traffic wardens seem to have stopped issuing parking tickets. I think it has been ambandomed, but even if not it is preventing the use of 25% of the EV bays Sherborne Street Cheltenham, 3rd January
item.description:

item.description:

item.title: SUGGESTION : Could you add 'hoods' to the green traffic lights at the new bus stop ?, 3rd January
item.description:
Hi, would you consider adding 'hoods' to the green traffic lights at the new bus stop ? This would hide the green from the traffic that is waiting at their main lights (going westbound, towards Elmbridge Court roundabout), and prevent drivers from trying to move (on a red) when they see the green (for the bus) appear in their periphery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Cable/pipe repair work damaged surgace, 2nd January
item.description:
There is a stretch of this path where people who were doing cable or pipe repair work have dug the path up and simply filled it back in and not relaid gravel and/or hardcore. This is resulting in a large part of the path being muddy and slippery. Disabled people cannot use the path. In order to try and avoid it, people are using the grass verge which in turn is becoming churned up. Somebody needs to come back and re lay this stretch of path ASAP
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warrener Close, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Subsidence, 2nd January
item.description:
The road on the right hand side heading towards the roundabout is subsiding particularly noticeable in the last few months following heavy rain. The road has developed two very noticeable dips.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Jersey Avenue, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
